memories.author: George Loomis Smith
memories.source: "125 Years: Olga: Memories and Potlucks" (Compiled by Irene Barfoot O'Neill)
memories.content: "For many years, Olga families went up on Mount Constitution for the Fourth of July, and stayed overnight. It was a lot of fun, good food and fellowship. We'd always take a blanket and, after finding a good place in the rocks, we would see all the fireworks from the different towns on the mainland. Bellingham, Blaine, Mt. Vernon, and Anacortes always put on a good show for us."

memories.author: Ken Culver
memories.content: Hitching a ride up Mt. Constitution from the mail truck and sledding down.
